lessons.title: Lesson 1: Introduction to the Coordinate Plane

games.name: Real-World Coordinate Hunt
games.implementationDetails: Present real-world scenarios (map, seating chart) and ask students to identify locations using coordinate pairs.
learningPoints: Understanding the need for coordinate systems

games.name: Point description
games.implementationDetails: Describe position of point using sentences to other students in game
learningPoints: Understanding need of points of reference

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Cartesian System: Axes and Origin

games.name: Axes Identifier
games.implementationDetails: Present a Cartesian plane (canvas or SVG). Ask the player to label the axes (x-axis, y-axis) and the origin. Use drag-and-drop or multiple-choice options. Provide immediate feedback.

games.name: Origin identifier
games.implementationDetails: Present lines crossing each other in multiple orientations. Ask the student to identify the cartesian coordinate representation

games.name: Cartesian plane component labeler
games.implementationDetails: Present unlabelled cartesian plane components like axis, quadrant with drag and drop functionality to label them
learningPoints: Understanding different components of cartesian plane

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Coordinates of a Point: Abscissa and Ordinate

games.name: Abscissa and Ordinate Identifier
games.implementationDetails: Display a point on the Cartesian plane. Ask the player to identify the abscissa and ordinate (input fields or multiple-choice). Highlight x and y coordinates, check values

games.name: Coordinate Builder
games.implementationDetails: Use input fields for x and y coordinates. Display the point on the plane after input. Provide visual feedback. Validate input (only numbers).

games.name: Component identifier
games.implementationDetails: Provide coordinates ask the students which is ordinate and abscissa number

games.name: Quadrant Identifier
games.implementationDetails: Display a Cartesian plane. Highlight a quadrant. Ask the player to identify the quadrant (I, II, III, IV) using buttons or multiple choice. Store answer, provide feedback.

games.name: Sign Match
games.implementationDetails: Display a quadrant name. ask Student to select the sign with which coordinate in that quadrant starts

games.name: Quadrant symbol identifier
games.implementationDetails: Present quadrant sign configuration and ask students quadrant number

lessons.title: Lesson 5: Identifying the Coordinates of a Point from a Graph

games.name: Coordinate Identifier
games.implementationDetails: Display a point on the plane. Ask the player to enter the coordinates (input fields). Check the input against the point's location. Feedback and points.

games.name: Coordinate multiplier
games.implementationDetails: Show coordinate plot and multiple choice question

lessons.title: Lesson 6: Plotting Points in the Cartesian Plane

games.name: Point Plotter
games.implementationDetails: Display coordinates (x, y). Allow player to click on the plane to plot the point. Check the plotted location for accuracy (within a tolerance). Provide feedback. Scoring system based on accuracy and speed.

games.name: Plotter number builder
games.implementationDetails: Plot multiple points on coordinate and draw shape

lessons.title: Lesson 7: Coordinates of Points on the Axes

games.name: Axiom identifier
games.implementationDetails: Present coordinates and ask whether this coordinate lies on this axis or not
